remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Hello, thank you for coming in today. I understand you’ve been experiencing language difficulty and weakness on your right side. Can you describe in more detail how these symptoms began and if they have changed since they first started?

Well, um… yes, that’s right. I’ve been having trouble with my speech, and, uh, my right side feels weak—especially my arm and shoulder. The weakness and the language difficulty kind of started suddenly, I think. I’m also having some pain in my right shoulder. I’m just… not sure what’s going on, and it’s making me pretty uncomfortable.

remedi_labels.value: weakness in right arm and shoulder
sudden onset of weakness and language difficulty

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Thank you for sharing that with me—I can understand how sudden weakness and difficulty with speech would be concerning. You mentioned weakness in your right arm and shoulder; have you also noticed any changes in your facial muscles, such as drooping or difficulty moving one side of your face?

remedi_labels.value: sudden weakness and difficulty with speech
changes in facial muscles such as drooping or difficulty moving one side of face

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Um… yes, actually, I think there’s some drooping on the right side of my face. It feels a bit numb, and I’ve noticed it’s harder to move that side. I guess that’s part of what’s making it tough to talk, too.

remedi_labels.value: drooping on the right side of face
numbness on the right side of face
harder to move right side of face

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Thank you for describing your symptoms so clearly. I understand that the right facial droop and numbness are making it difficult to speak. In addition to the weakness and facial changes, have you experienced any difficulty with coordination or movement in your right leg as well?

remedi_labels.value: difficulty with coordination or movement in right leg

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Let me think… yes, I guess my right leg does feel weaker than usual. It’s not as strong, and when I try to move it, it just feels slower. I haven’t really tried walking much since all this started, but the coordination on that side just isn’t the same. And, um, the language difficulty is still there—I’m having trouble getting words out the way I want. It’s all pretty uncomfortable.

Thank you for explaining how your symptoms are affecting both your right arm and leg, as well as your speech. To help with my assessment, have you experienced any changes in sensation—such as numbness, tingling, or loss of experiencing—on the right side of your clinical examination in addition to the weakness?

remedi_labels.value: symptoms affecting right arm, leg, and speech
changes in sensation such as numbness, tingling, or loss of sensation on the right side

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Well, um… yes, I think there is some numbness on the right side of my face, especially where it’s drooping. It’s a bit hard to feel symptoms there. And, actually, I’m having trouble enunciating words—my speech just isn’t coming out right. I haven’t really noticed much tingling, but the weakness and the facial droop are definitely there. Should I be worried about these symptoms?

remedi_labels.value: numbness on the right side of face
Should I be worried about these symptoms?

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’d be worried about these symptoms—sudden weakness and facial droop can be very unsettling. To help with my assessment, have you noticed any difficulty swallowing or changes in your ability to control saliva since these symptoms began?

remedi_labels.value: changes in ability to control saliva

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Well, um… yes, I have noticed that I’m having trouble with saliva—it sometimes dribbles out of the right corner of my mouth, and I can’t really control it well. Swallowing is a bit harder too, but mostly it’s just the saliva issue. Also, when you asked me to spell ‘world’ backwards earlier, I just couldn’t do it. My speech is really non-fluent—I have to work hard to get words out, and it’s frustrating. I’m just not able to speak properly, and it’s making me pretty uncomfortable.

remedi_labels.value: saliva dribbling from right corner of mouth

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Thank you for describing your symptoms so clearly—it helps guide my assessment. In addition to the right-sided weakness and facial droop, have you noticed any changes in your vision, such as double vision or loss of vision, since these symptoms began?

No, I haven’t really noticed any changes in my vision—no double vision or loss of vision that I can tell. It’s mostly just the weakness on my right side and the trouble with my speech. Actually, I’m having a lot of difficulty repeating longer sentences, and my speech is, um, pretty slurred—I think that’s called dysarthria, right? It’s just really hard to get the words out clearly. 

Should I be worried that these symptoms are all happening together? Is there something serious going on?

remedi_labels.value: Should I be worried that these symptoms are all happening together?
Is there something serious going on?

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: I can understand why you’re experiencing anxious—experiencing right-sided weakness, facial droop, and difficulty with speech all at once is understandably concerning. To further clarify your symptoms, have you noticed any changes in your ability to feel touch, temperature, or pain on your right side during your clinical examination?

remedi_labels.value: changes in ability to feel touch, temperature, or pain on right side

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Well, um… I think my sense of touch on the right side is a bit off—it’s not completely numb, but it just doesn’t feel quite right compared to my left. I haven’t really noticed much difference with temperature or pain, though. 

One thing that’s been bothering me a lot is the saliva dribbling out of the right corner of my mouth—I just can’t seem to control it. And, actually, I realized I can’t read a sentence now, which is really frustrating. Is this all part of the same problem? I’m just feeling really uncomfortable and, honestly, I’d like to know if there’s something you can do to help me get some relief.

remedi_labels.value: altered sense of touch on the right side
saliva dribbling out of the right corner of mouth
Is this all part of the same problem?
Is there something you can do to help me get some relief?

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Thank you for describing your symptoms in detail—it’s helpful for my assessment. In addition to the right-sided weakness and facial droop, have you experienced any difficulty with fine motor tasks on your right side, such as buttoning a shirt or holding objects, since these symptoms began?

remedi_labels.value: Thank you for describing your symptoms in detail—it’s helpful for my assessment.
difficulty with fine motor tasks on right side such as buttoning a shirt or holding objects

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Yes, actually, I have had a lot of trouble with symptoms like buttoning my shirt or even just holding onto objects with my right hand. My grip is much weaker, and sometimes I feel like my coordination is off—it’s slower than usual. 

Also, I noticed when I try to stick out my tongue, it looks like it’s deviated, probably because of the facial weakness. And, um, I think there’s increased tone in my right arm—it feels stiffer and harder to move. 

All of this together is making me pretty uncomfortable. Is this something that can be treated? I’d really like to get some relief from these symptoms if possible.

remedi_labels.value: trouble holding objects with right hand
Is this something that can be treated?
I’d really like to get some relief from these symptoms if possible.

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text: Thank you for describing your symptoms so thoroughly. Based on your sudden onset of right-sided weakness, right facial droop, speech difficulties, and changes in coordination and tone, my assessment is that these symptoms are likely related to a neurological condition, possibly affecting the left side of your brain. To further guide my assessment, have you experienced any recent episodes of headache, loss of consciousness, or confusion since these symptoms began?

remedi_labels.value: neurological condition possibly affecting the left side of the brain

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Well, um… no, I haven’t had any headpains or lost consciousness. I don’t think I’ve been confused either—at least, not more than just being frustrated with these symptoms. My right arm weakness is still pretty bad, and the coordination on that side is definitely slower. I just can’t do symptoms with my right hand like I used to.

You mentioned this could be a neurological condition affecting the left side of my brain—should I be worried about something like a stroke? Is there anything you can do to help me get some relief from these symptoms? I’m really uncomfortable and just want to know what happens next.

I can understand why you’re experiencing anxious—sudden right-sided weakness, facial droop, and speech difficulty are understandably distressing symptoms. Based on your description and my assessment so far, these symptoms are highly suggestive of an acute neurological event, such as a stroke, affecting the left side of your brain. To further guide my clinical evaluation, have you experienced any recent changes in bladder or bowel control since these symptoms began?

remedi_labels.value: acute neurological event (such as a stroke)
recent changes in bladder or bowel control

remedi_style_dialogue_annotations.utterance_text:
Actually, yes—I have had some changes with my bladder. I wasn’t really able to go, and when they examinationed, I had quite a bit of urine retained—about 750cc, I think they said. That’s not normal for me at all. My bowels seem okay so far, though.

Um, you mentioned coordination earlier—when you did those rapid alternating movements, I could do them on the left side just fine, but on the right, it was much slower and weaker. My gait hasn’t really been assessed yet because of my bradyarrhythmia; my heart rate’s been dropping into the 30s, especially when I’m asleep. 

I’m just feeling really uncomfortable with all these symptoms happening at once. Is there something you can do to help me get some relief? And is this definitely a stroke, or could it be something else?

remedi_labels.value: right side slower and weaker rapid alternating movements
heart rate dropping into the 30s, especially when asleep
Is there something you can do to help me get some relief?
Is this definitely a stroke, or could it be something else?
